body_html:
For the benchmark, I built the clone of my repo, made it into a wheel, installed it in a virtualenv and ran:

python3 batch_norm_benchmark.py --benchmarks=BatchNormBenchmark

I'm attaching the result below. This is the right way to do the benchmark, right? (it looks like, but I'm a little confused...)

I haven't made the test for the device placement. I think I got the basic ideas on testing by reading nn_test.py or such, but I couldn't find some kind of reference or doc to help me out. To run tests, can I just execute the script like above, with some proper arguments?

python3 batch_norm_benchmark.py --benchmarks=BatchNormBenchmark
I'm attaching the result below. This is the right way to do the benchmark, right? (it looks like, but I'm a little confused...)
I haven't made the test for the device placement. I think I got the basic ideas on testing by reading nn_test.py or such, but I couldn't find some kind of reference or doc to help me out. To run tests, can I just execute the script like above, with some proper arguments?
body:
For the benchmark, I built the clone of my repo, made it into a wheel, installed it in a virtualenv and ran:
```sh
python3 batch_norm_benchmark.py --benchmarks=BatchNormBenchmark
```
I'm attaching the result below. This is the right way to do the benchmark, right? (it looks like, but I'm a little confused...)

I haven't made the test for the device placement. I think I got the basic ideas on testing by reading `nn_test.py` or such, but I couldn't find some kind of reference or doc to help me out. To run tests, can I just execute the script like above, with some proper arguments?
